Service.Name: OnEarth:WMS:Tile
Service.Title: WMS Tile service
Service.Abstract: DRAFT VERSION, the exact format of this configuration file is subject to changes. Optimized tiled WMS service for high volume applications. This document exposes the available tiled datasets and the patterns to access them. Applications that need fast access to tiled data should only use patterns documented here. A TiledGroup refers to the same image. Within a TilePattern, multiple access patterns could be present, representing the same tileset. The patterns contain the exact case, parameter order and parameter content to be used for accessing a given tileset. The bbox argument values are the ones for the top-left tile in each tileset.

TiledGroup.Name: Global Mosaic, pan sharpened visual
TiledGroup.Title: Global Mosaic, pan sharpened visual
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by NASA WorldWind and WorldKit. Due to alignment, WorldWind can only use levels with 4 degrees or less per tile. While the coverage is global, real data is only present between 60S and 83N. Configuration file for WorldWind avalaible at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth.xml". WorldKit sample configuration for this layer at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/WK/visual". Pansharpened Data has a native resolution of 0.5 arc-seconds per pixel (15m per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: Global Mosaic, pan sharpened, pseudocolor
TiledGroup.Title: Global Mosaic, pan sharpened, pseudocolor
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by NASA WorldWind and WorldKit. Due to alignment, WorldWind can only use levels with 4 degrees or less per tile. While the coverage is global, real data is only present between 60S and 83N. Configuration file for WorldWind avalaible at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth.xml". WorldKit sample configuration for this layer at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/WK". Pansharpened Data has a native resolution of 0.5 arc-seconds per pixel (15m per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: Global Mosaic, visual
TiledGroup.Title: Global Mosaic, visual
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by NASA WorldWind and WorldKit. Due to alignment issues, WorldWind can only use levels with 4 degrees or less per tile. While the coverage is global, real data is only present between 60S and 83N. Configuration file for WorldWind avalaible at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth.xml". WorldKit sample configuration for this layer at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/WK/visual_base". This layer is the visual (321) non pan sharpened, it has a native resolution of 1 arc-second (30m per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: Global Mosaic, pseudocolor
TiledGroup.Title: Global Mosaic, pseudocolor
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by NASA WorldWind and WorldKit. Due to alignment issues, WorldWind can only use levels with 4 degrees or less per tile. While the coverage is global, real data is only present between 60S and 83N. Configuration file for WorldWind avalaible at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth.xml". WorldKit sample configuration for this layer at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/WK/base". This layer is the pseudocolor (742) non pan sharpened, it has a native resolution of 1 arc-second (30m per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: Daily Planet
TiledGroup.Title: Continuously updating earth image, from MODIS TERRA
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by Google Earth, NASA WorldWind and WorldKit. Due to alignment issues, WorldWind can only use levels with 4 degrees or less per tile. Configuration file for WorldWind avalaible at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth.xml" Google Earth KML file "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth_DailyPlanet.kml" WorldKit sample configuration for this layer at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/WK/daily_planet" This cache set is the native dataset, with a maximum resolution of 1/512 degrees per pixel (7.03125 arc-seconds per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: Daily Afternoon
TiledGroup.Title: Continuously updating earth image, from MODIS AQUA
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by Google Earth, NASA WorldWind and WorldKit. Due to alignment issues, WorldWind can only use levels at 4 degrees or less per tile. Configuration file for WorldWind avalaible at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth.xml" Google Earth KML file "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth_DailyAfternoon.kml" WorldKit sample configuration for this layer at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/WK/daily_afternoon" This cache set is the native dataset, with a maximum resolution of 1/512 degrees per pixel (7.03125 arc-seconds per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: MODIS TERRA visual
TiledGroup.Title: Composite of MODIS TERRA subsets from yesterday
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by NASA WorldWind and WorldKit. Due to alignment issues, WorldWind can only use levels with 4 degrees or less per tile. Configuration file for WorldWind avalaible at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/OnEarth.xml". WorldKit sample configuration for this layer at "http://OnEarth.jpl.nasa.gov/WK/daily_terra". This layer is built daily from the visual TERRA subsets available at "http://rapidfire.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/subsets". The native resolution is 1/512 degrees per pixel (7.03125 arc-seconds per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: NASA BMNG
TiledGroup.Title: Full resolution NASA BMNG
TiledGroup.Abstract: NASA BMNG is a MODIS based image of the world. There are three versions, each with one image for every month of a year. The most common version is hillshaded to increase the three dimensional look based on land and ocean elevation. This version is available as tiles 480x480, which preserves the raw resolution of the source data. A second version, has uniformly dark blue oceans, without bathymetry shading while the third version does not have any elevation based shading, neither ocean nor land.

TiledGroup.Name: BMNG with bathymetry, hillshaded
TiledGroup.Title: The full resolution BMNG in jpeg tiled format
TiledGroup.Abstract: There are twelfe styles of this dataset, each one corresponding to a given month of the year. Tiles are 480x480 pixels

TiledGroup.Name: BMNG January
TiledGroup.Title: BMNG with bathymetry, hillshaded, January
TiledGroup.Abstract: Jpeg tiles as used by WorldKit. The native resolution is 2/480 degrees per pixel (15 arc-seconds per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: MODIS TERRA, BMNG background
TiledGroup.Title: Composite of MODIS TERRA subsets from yesterday on Blue Marble Next Generation background
TiledGroup.Abstract: Preblended JPEG tiles using two separate layers. The BMNG background uses the current month, the daily_terra is the latest available. This tile set updates daily, after daily_terra itself is updated. The native resolution is 1.40625/512 degrees per pixel (9.8876953125 arc-seconds per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: Global SRTM Elevation
TiledGroup.Title: 3 arc-second (90m) SRTM elevation, with the holes filled, packed as signed short int image/png tiles
TiledGroup.Abstract: This dataset is derived from the public global 90m SRTM elevation, packed as 300x300 pixel, 16bit per pixel png files. The data was prepared by NASA Learning Technologies for use by the NASA WorldWind application. The 16 bit short integers contained in the PNG tiles should be interpreted as signed short. The highest resolution is 1/1200 degrees per pixel (3 arc-seconds per pixel).

TiledGroup.Name: Continental US Elevation
TiledGroup.Title: NED derived elevation, 1 arc-second (30m) elevation dataset, 16 bit PNG
TiledGroup.Abstract: This dataset is derived from the continental US NED data, served as 300x300 pixel, 16bit per pixel PNG. The 16 bit short integers should be interpreted as signed short, representing the elevation in feet (0.3084m). The highest resolution is 1/3600 degrees per pixel (1 arc-seconds per pixel).
